Name: Bartlett
Text: Redwater’s running smooth, Lieutenant. Almost feels… too smooth.

Choices.Text: Still no word from Ford Island?

Name: Bartlett
Text: That’s not superstition, it’s instinct. After Pearl, I trust my gut more than any radar.

Name: Bartlett
Text: Radio's fuzzy. They’re either too busy… or something’s blocking it.

Name: Bartlett
Text: There’s no such thing as luck out here. Only decisions and consequences.

Name: Bartlett
Text: Quiet officers don’t live long. Speak your thoughts, Hale.

Name: Bartlett
Text: You ever wonder if we’re alone out here? I mean truly alone?

Name: Bartlett
Text: I’d prefer enemy subs. At least they’re predictable.

Name: Bartlett
Text: No. That’s what’s troubling me.

Name: Bartlett
Text: No. I think… we’re being listened to.

Name: Porter
Text: Sir, there’s something weird in the signal. Repeating pulses… not Morse, not Japanese.

Choices.Text: Could be distortion from the storm.

Name: Porter
Text: Could be. But it’s rhythmic. Feels... deliberate.

Name: Porter
Text: No language I know, sir. Just… noise that wants to be words.

Name: Porter
Text: I’ve been trying. It’s not a frequency issue—it’s embedded beneath the broadcast.

Name: Porter
Text: Sir... it's like it's waiting for someone to respond.

Choices.Text: Mark the frequency. I want that logged.

Name: Porter
Text: Yes, sir. But... what if someone already did?

Name: Porter
Text: Aye. I’ll keep it off open channel.

Name: Porter
Text: Understood, sir. Marking now.

Name: Narrator
Text: *Just as you finish speaking with Porter, alarms blare. A rumble shakes the deck. The ship lurches violently.*

Name: Bartlett
Text: Brace for impact! Unknown contact—port side—full lock—

Name: Narrator
Text: *Your vision blurs. Porter screams. Something slams the hull. Darkness.*
